questions.text: Which MySQL command do you use to remove an entire row from a table?
questions.explanation: When you need to delete a row from a table, you can use the DELETE command.

questions.text: What special value is used in SQL to represent cases in which an actual value is unknown, unavailable, or not applicable?
questions.explanation: In SQL, null is a special value used to represent cases in which an actual value is unknown, unavailable, or not applicable.

questions.text: Which MySQL command do you use to define a table's structure by listing its columns, data types, and column lengths?
questions.explanation: The CREATE TABLE command is used to describe the layout of a table, including column names, data types, and lengths.

questions.text: You indicate the end of a SQL command by typing a ____.
questions.explanation: A semicolon ends a statement in SQL.

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid name for a table?
questions.explanation: Table names must start with a letter and can contain letters, numbers, and underscores, but cannot contain spaces.

questions.text: A text file with a .sql extension that contains SQL commands is a _____.
questions.explanation: SQL commands can be saved in a text file with .sql extension, known as a script file.

questions.text: It is recommended that table names be limited to _____.
questions.explanation: Most database systems recommend limiting identifier names to 30 characters for compatibility and readability.

questions.text: A relation that does not contain any repeating groups is in _____.
questions.explanation: A table (relation) is in first normal form (1NF) when it does not contain a repeating group.

questions.text: The process of determining the particular tables and columns that will comprise a database is known as _____.
questions.explanation: Database design is the process of determining the structure of a database, including its tables and columns.

questions.text: A property of an entity is _____.
questions.explanation: An attribute is a property or characteristic of an entity.

questions.text: The duplication of data is formally called _____.
questions.explanation: When the same data appears in multiple places in a database, it is called redundancy.

questions.text: To examine the structure of a table in MySQL, including column names and data types, you use the _____ command.
questions.explanation: The DESCRIBE command shows the structure of a table, including column names, data types, and null status.
